result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah M. Nieves

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

10:02 AM DA calls case and states appearances Defendant Isaiah M. Nieves in court.  Attorney Joseph L Bauer in court for Isaiah M. Nieves.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. DA Kelz states Victim Right's Legislation has been complied with. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to Ct. 1 in 22CF10, Ct. 1 in 22CM04, and Ct. 1 in 22CM16 the State will move to Dismiss Ct. 2 in case 22CM16. DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 1 in 22CF10, Ct. 1 in 22CM04, and Ct. 1 in 22CM16 therefore Ct. 2 in case 22CM16 is DISMISSED. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC in cases: 22CM04 and 22CM1 and entry of DEJ in case 22CF10. Comments by parties. 

22CF10:
Ct .1 - DEJ for 18 months 

22CM04:
Ct. 1- Withheld Sentence 
1 Year Probation 
Conditions of Probation:
$243 Court costs 
$200 DNA + Sample 
AODA Assessment 
$65 Service by DA fees 

22CM16:
Ct. 1- Withheld Sentence 
1 Year Probation 
Conditions of Probation:
$243 Court costs 
$200 DNA + Sample 
AODA Assessment 
$45 Service by DA fees 

Ct. 2- DISMISSED 


Defendant is given 0 days jail credit. 


Appeal Rights Given
Motion hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:00 AM DA calls cases 22CF10,22CM04,22CM16 and states appearances. Prosecuting attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaiah M. Nieves in court.  Attorney Joseph L Bauer in court for Isaiah M. Nieves. DA Kelz moves to adjourn the motion hearing in case 22CM04. So ordered. In case 22CM16 Attorney Bauer gives status. In case 22CF10 Attorney Bauer states his client will waive his preliminary hearing. Attorney Bauer presents the court with a copy of the Preliminary hearing waiver signed by himself and his client. Court goes over the form with the defendant line item by line item. Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Motion hearings in cases: 22CM04 and 22CM16 to be rescheduled for 09/15/2022 at 10:00 AM
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 11:00 AM DA Kelz calls case and states appearances. Defendant Isaiah M. Nieves appeared with attorney Joseph L Bauer.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states Attorney Bauer had filed for an adjournment on 02/23/2022 and questions Defendant and Attorney Bauer as to status. Attorney Bauer states his client wishes to waive the time limits for a preliminary hearing. So ordered. Court adjourned.

Adjustment Number: 22A 000335,
Payable Number: 61463,
Receipt Number: 22R 000557,
Amount: $20.00
Preliminary hearing on February 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): J.L.S.   unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts office or The Price County Sheriff's Office after Hours. 
No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:07 AM DA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Isaiah M. Nieves appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   Notice of right to attorney given to DE. DA Kelz gives bond recommendations. Bond ordered as requested. Preliminary Hearing requested, time limits NOT waived.
State's demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA evidence
